it.polimi.deib.newdem.adrenaline.common.controller

Class UserGreeter

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.deib.newdem.adrenaline.common.controller.UserGreeter

  • public class UserGreeter
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserGreeter()
      Create a new, empty user greeter.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      User accept()
      Waits for a client, listening for a user that may connect through any of the added modules.
      void addUserModule(IncomingUserModule module)
      Adds the given module to the modules that have to be used to retrieve incoming users.
      void close()
      Closes all the associated modules by killing the threads and then calls, for each module, IncomingUserModule.close() on the current thread.
      void init()
      Initializes all the modules by calling the method IncomingUserModule.init() on the current thread.
      void start()
      Starts all the modules, by calling UserGreeter.runModule() on a separate thread for each module.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserGreeter

        public UserGreeter()
        Create a new, empty user greeter.

    • Method Detail

      • addUserModule

        public void addUserModule(IncomingUserModule module)
        Adds the given module to the modules that have to be used to retrieve incoming users.

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes all the modules by calling the method IncomingUserModule.init() on the current thread.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts all the modules, by calling UserGreeter.runModule() on a separate thread for each module.

      • accept

        public User accept()
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits for a client, listening for a user that may connect through any of the added modules. The method will return when a user has successfully established the connection according to the criteria defined by the corresponding module.
        Returns:
        A User object representing the newly connected client.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current thread receives an interrupt while waiting.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes all the associated modules by killing the threads and then calls, for each module, IncomingUserModule.close() on the current thread.
